intro: Alyssum epirotum, commonly known as the Epirotic alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale purple, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Alyssum epirotum is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
